### Bayesian Approach:

**Formula:** P(Œ∏|data) ‚àù P(data|Œ∏) √ó P(Œ∏)

| Term | Meaning |
|------|--------|
| Prior | Belief before data |
| Likelihood | Probability of data |
| Posterior | Updated belief |

### Prior Types:

| Type | When to Use |
|------|-------------|
| Uninformative | Limited knowledge |
| Weakly informative | Some constraints |
| Informative | Strong prior knowledge |
| Empirical | Data-driven |

### Markov Chain Monte Carlo:

**Purpose:** Sample from posterior distribution.

### Algorithms:
| Algorithm | Characteristics |
|-----------|----------------|
| Metropolis | Simple, general |
| Gibbs | Uses conditionals |
| HMC | Efficient for continuous |

### Model Comparison:

| Method | Measures |
|--------|----------|
| WAIC | Predictive accuracy |
| LOO-CV | Leave-one-out |
| Bayes Factor | Evidence ratio |

### Credible Interval:

**Definition:** Range where parameter lies with given probability.

### vs Confidence Interval:
| Type | Interpretation |
|------|---------------|
| Credible | 95% probability parameter is here |
| Confidence | 95% of samples contain true value |

### Bayesian Tools:

| Tool | Language |
|------|----------|
| Stan | Multi-language |
| PyMC | Python |
| brms | R |
| Edward | TensorFlow |
